Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that not one penny of the recaptured money will go to public education in Texas, when in fact, some funding does go towards education.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to back up the statement that none of the recaptured money will go to public education. The expert's analysis shows that there are revenue sources and funding commitments for public education.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that all the recaptured money should go directly to public education, without considering other budgetary needs or priorities.
Exist alternative explanation: There could be alternative explanations for the allocation of the recaptured money, such as other government expenses or budgetary decisions that impact education funding.
